page.title: 17LOCAL PLACE NAMES,PLOCKTON.
page.content: ALMOST ALL OF THE PLACE NAMES HERE ARE IN{GAELIC.}ONLY ONE VILLAGE NAME COMES FROM{NORSE}(DUIRINISH). {DUIRINISH=DYR NES=CAPE OF THE DEER.} THE OTHER SETTLEMENT NAMES ARE GAELIC. {PLOCKTON=PLOC=A LUMP OR MASS OF LAND. {DRUMBUIE=DRIUM BUIDHE=YELLOW RIDGE. {ACHNANDARACH=FIELD OF THE OAK TREES. {PORT AN EORNA=BARLEY PORT.} AROUND THE SEACOAST,THERE ARE NAMES FOR ISLANDS,ROCKS AND BAYS. {EILEAN DUBH=BLACK ISLAND. {CAMUS AN ARBHAIR=BAY OF THE CORN. {SGEIR BUIDHE=YELLOW ROCK. } MANY FEATURES ON LAND ALSO HAVE GAELIC NAMES.HERE ARE JUST THREE. {CNOC MOR=THE BIG HILL. {AN DUBH AIRD=THE BLACK HEIGHT. {LOCHAN NA BA RUAIDHE=SMALL LOCH OF THE {RED CATTLE. } MANY HOUSES TOO HAVE GAELIC NAMES e.g. {DAL NA MARA=SEA BANK.
